1) High-level plan (what to deliver)

  • Backend: REST API (Express) with JWT authentication, role-based authorization (Admin, User, StoreOwner). Sequelize ORM for PostgreSQL, migrations, models: User, Store, Rating.

  • Frontend: React app with routes for Signup/Login, Admin dashboard, User store list & rating UI, StoreOwner dashboard.

2) Database schema (Postgres) — ER summary

Tables:

  • users

    • id, name, email (unique), password_hash, address, role (admin | user | store_owner), createdAt, updatedAt

  • stores

    • id, name, email, address, ownerId (FK -> users.id, nullable), createdAt, updatedAt

  • ratings

    • id, userId (FK -> users.id), storeId (FK -> stores.id), rating (INT 1-5), createdAt, updatedAt

    • Unique constraint (userId, storeId) so a user has at most one rating per store.

SQL snippet (Postgres):

sql
CREATE TABLE users (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(60) NOT NULL,
  email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
  password_hash TEXT NOT NULL,
  address VARCHAR(400),
  role VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'user',
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT now()
);

CREATE TABLE stores (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  email VARCHAR(255),
  address VARCHAR(400),
  owner_id INTEGER REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT now()
);

CREATE TABLE ratings (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INTEGER REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  store_id INTEGER REFERENCES stores(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  rating INTEGER CHECK (rating BETWEEN 1 AND 5),
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT now(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT now(),
  UNIQUE (user_id, store_id)
);

Sequelize models (simplified)

Create models/index.js:

js
const { Sequelize, DataTypes } = require('sequelize');
const sequelize = new Sequelize(process.env.DATABASE_URL, {
  dialect: 'postgres',
  logging: false
});

const User = require('./user')(sequelize, DataTypes);
const Store = require('./store')(sequelize, DataTypes);
const Rating = require('./rating')(sequelize, DataTypes);

User.hasMany(Rating, { foreignKey: 'userId' });
Rating.belongsTo(User, { foreignKey: 'userId' });

Store.hasMany(Rating, { foreignKey: 'storeId' });
Rating.belongsTo(Store, { foreignKey: 'storeId' });

User.hasMany(Store, { foreignKey: 'ownerId' });
Store.belongsTo(User, { foreignKey: 'ownerId' });

module.exports = { sequelize, Sequelize, User, Store, Rating };

models/user.js:

js
const bcrypt = require('bcrypt');
module.exports = (sequelize, DataTypes) => {
  const User = sequelize.define('User', {
    name: { type: DataTypes.STRING(60), allowNull: false,
      validate: { len: [20,60] } },
    email: { type: DataTypes.STRING, allowNull: false, unique: true, validate: { isEmail: true } },
    password_hash: { type: DataTypes.STRING, allowNull: false },
    address: { type: DataTypes.STRING(400) },
    role: { type: DataTypes.ENUM('admin','user','store_owner'), defaultValue: 'user' }
  }, {
    tableName: 'users',
    underscored: true
  });

  User.prototype.validPassword = function(password) {
    return bcrypt.compare(password, this.password_hash);
  };

  return User;
};

models/store.js:

js
module.exports = (sequelize, DataTypes) => {
  const Store = sequelize.define('Store', {
    name: { type: DataTypes.STRING, allowNull: false },
    email: { type: DataTypes.STRING },
    address: { type: DataTypes.STRING(400) },
  }, {
    tableName: 'stores',
    underscored: true
  });
  return Store;
};

models/rating.js:

js
module.exports = (sequelize, DataTypes) => {
  const Rating = sequelize.define('Rating', {
    rating: { type: DataTypes.INTEGER, allowNull: false, validate: { min:1, max:5 } }
  }, {
    tableName: 'ratings',
    underscored: true
  });
  return Rating;
};

Auth utils + middleware

utils/jwt.js:

js
const jwt = require('jsonwebtoken');
const secret = process.env.JWT_SECRET || 'change_this_secret';
function sign(user) {
  return jwt.sign({ id: user.id, role: user.role }, secret, { expiresIn: '7d' });
}
function verify(token) {
  return jwt.verify(token, secret);
}
module.exports = { sign, verify };

middleware/auth.js:

js
const jwt = require('jsonwebtoken');
const { User } = require('../models');
const secret = process.env.JWT_SECRET || 'change_this_secret';

async function authenticate(req, res, next) {
  const header = req.header('Authorization');
  if (!header) return res.status(401).json({ message: 'No token' });
  const token = header.replace('Bearer ', '');
  try {
    const payload = jwt.verify(token, secret);
    const user = await User.findByPk(payload.id);
    if (!user) return res.status(401).json({ message: 'Invalid token' });
    req.user = user;
    next();
  } catch (err) {
    return res.status(401).json({ message: 'Invalid token' });
  }
}

function authorize(...roles) {
  return (req, res, next) => {
    if (!req.user) return res.status(401).json({ message: 'Unauthenticated' });
    if (!roles.includes(req.user.role)) return res.status(403).json({ message: 'Forbidden' });
    next();
  };
}

module.exports = { authenticate, authorize };

Routes — auth (signup/login)

routes/auth.js:

js
const express = require('express');
const router = express.Router();
const bcrypt = require('bcrypt');
const { body, validationResult } = require('express-validator');
const { User } = require('../models');
const { sign } = require('../utils/jwt');

const passwordRegex = /^(?=.*[A-Z])(?=.*[^A-Za-z0-9]).{8,16}$/;

router.post('/signup', [
  body('name').isLength({ min:20, max:60 }),
  body('email').isEmail(),
  body('address').optional().isLength({ max:400 }),
  body('password').matches(passwordRegex)
], async (req, res) => {
  const errors = validationResult(req);
  if (!errors.isEmpty()) return res.status(422).json({ errors: errors.array() });
  const { name, email, address, password } = req.body;
  try {
    const existing = await User.findOne({ where: { email } });
    if (existing) return res.status(400).json({ message: 'Email already used' });
    const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, 10);
    const user = await User.create({ name, email, address, password_hash: hash, role: 'user' });
    const token = sign(user);
    res.json({ token, user: { id: user.id, name: user.name, email: user.email, role: user.role } });
  } catch (err) { res.status(500).json({ message: err.message }) }
});

router.post('/login', [
  body('email').isEmail(),
  body('password').isString()
], async (req,res) => {
  const { email, password } = req.body;
  try {
    const user = await User.findOne({ where: { email } });
    if (!user) return res.status(401).json({ message: 'Invalid credentials' });
    const valid = await user.validPassword(password);
    if (!valid) return res.status(401).json({ message: 'Invalid credentials' });
    const token = sign(user);
    res.json({ token, user: { id:user.id, name:user.name, email:user.email, role:user.role }});
  } catch (err) { res.status(500).json({ message: err.message }) }
});

module.exports = router;

Admin endpoints (summary & create users/stores, lists with filters and sort)

routes/admin.js (core endpoints):

js
const express = require('express');
const router = express.Router();
const { authenticate, authorize } = require('../middleware/auth');
const { User, Store, Rating } = require('../models');
const { Op } = require('sequelize');

router.use(authenticate, authorize('admin'));

// dashboard counts
router.get('/dashboard', async (req,res) => {
  const totalUsers = await User.count();
  const totalStores = await Store.count();
  const totalRatings = await Rating.count();
  res.json({ totalUsers, totalStores, totalRatings });
});

// add new user (admin creates normal user or admin)
router.post('/users', async (req,res) => {
  const { name, email, password, address, role } = req.body;
  // For brevity: same validation as signup; hash password & create user
  const bcrypt = require('bcrypt');
  if (!['user','admin','store_owner'].includes(role)) return res.status(400).json({ message:'invalid role' });
  const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, 10);
  const user = await User.create({ name, email, address, role, password_hash: hash });
  res.json({ user: { id:user.id, name:user.name, email:user.email, role:user.role }});
});

// list users with filters & sorting
router.get('/users', async (req,res) => {
  const { q, role, sortBy='name', order='ASC', page=1, limit=20 } = req.query;
  const where = {};
  if (role) where.role = role;
  if (q) where[Op.or] = [
    { name: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } },
    { email: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } },
    { address: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } }
  ];
  const users = await User.findAndCountAll({
    where, order: [[sortBy, order]], limit: +limit, offset: (page-1)*limit
  });
  res.json(users);
});

// list stores with overall rating
router.get('/stores', async (req,res) => {
  const { q, sortBy='name', order='ASC', page=1, limit=20 } = req.query;
  const where = {};
  if (q) where[Op.or] = [
    { name: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } },
    { email: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } },
    { address: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } }
  ];
  // fetch stores and attach avg rating
  const stores = await Store.findAll({ where, order: [[sortBy, order]], limit: +limit, offset: (page-1)*limit });
  const result = await Promise.all(stores.map(async s => {
    const avg = await Rating.findOne({
      attributes:[[Rating.sequelize.fn('AVG', Rating.sequelize.col('rating')), 'avgRating']],
      where: { storeId: s.id },
      raw: true
    });
    return { store: s, avgRating: avg.avgRating ? parseFloat(avg.avgRating).toFixed(2) : null };
  }));
  res.json(result);
});

module.exports = router;

Store and Rating endpoints (for users & store owners)

routes/stores.js:

js
const express = require('express');
const router = express.Router();
const { Store, Rating, User } = require('../models');
const { authenticate, authorize } = require('../middleware/auth');
const { Op } = require('sequelize');

// public list (users can view)
router.get('/', authenticate, async (req,res) => {
  const { q, sortBy='name', order='ASC', page=1, limit=20 } = req.query;
  const where = {};
  if (q) where[Op.or] = [{ name: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } }, { address: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } }];
  const stores = await Store.findAll({ where, order: [[sortBy, order]], limit: +limit, offset: (page-1)*limit });
  // attach overall rating and if current user rated
  const result = await Promise.all(stores.map(async s => {
    const avg = await Rating.findOne({
      attributes:[[Rating.sequelize.fn('AVG', Rating.sequelize.col('rating')), 'avgRating']],
      where: { storeId: s.id }, raw: true
    });
    const userRating = await Rating.findOne({ where: { storeId: s.id, userId: req.user.id }});
    return {
      id: s.id, name: s.name, address: s.address, email: s.email,
      avgRating: avg.avgRating ? parseFloat(avg.avgRating).toFixed(2) : null,
      userRating: userRating ? userRating.rating : null
    };
  }));
  res.json(result);
});

// store owner dashboard: list users who rated this owner's stores
router.get('/owner/dashboard', authenticate, authorize('store_owner'), async (req,res) => {
  // find stores owned by req.user
  const stores = await Store.findAll({ where: { ownerId: req.user.id }});
  const storeIds = stores.map(s=>s.id);
  const ratings = await Rating.findAll({
    where: { storeId: storeIds },
    include: [{ model: User, attributes: ['id','name','email','address'] }, { model: Store }]
  });
  // average rating per store:
  const avgByStore = {};
  for (const s of stores) {
    const avg = await Rating.findOne({
      attributes:[[Rating.sequelize.fn('AVG', Rating.sequelize.col('rating')), 'avgRating']],
      where: { storeId: s.id }, raw: true
    });
    avgByStore[s.id] = avg.avgRating ? parseFloat(avg.avgRating).toFixed(2) : null;
  }
  res.json({ stores, avgByStore, ratings });
});

module.exports = router;

routes/ratings.js:

js
const express = require('express');
const router = express.Router();
const { Rating } = require('../models');
const { authenticate, authorize } = require('../middleware/auth');

// submit or update rating
router.post('/', authenticate, authorize('user','store_owner','admin'), async (req,res) => {
  const { storeId, rating } = req.body;
  if (!storeId || !Number.isInteger(rating) || rating < 1 || rating > 5) return res.status(400).json({ message: 'Invalid' });
  try {
    const existing = await Rating.findOne({ where: { storeId, userId: req.user.id }});
    if (existing) {
      existing.rating = rating;
      await existing.save();
      return res.json({ message: 'Rating updated', rating: existing });
    }
    const newRating = await Rating.create({ storeId, userId: req.user.id, rating });
    res.json({ message: 'Rating created', rating: newRating });
  } catch (err) { res.status(500).json({ message: err.message }); }
});

// optionally: delete rating
router.delete('/:id', authenticate, async (req,res) => {
  const r = await Rating.findByPk(req.params.id);
  if (!r) return res.status(404).json({ message: 'Not found' });
  if (r.userId !== req.user.id && req.user.role !== 'admin') return res.status(403).json({ message: 'Forbidden' });
  await r.destroy();
  res.json({ message: 'Deleted' });
});

module.exports = router;

4) Frontend — React (core ideas + code snippets)

services/api.js

js
const API_BASE = process.env.REACT_APP_API || 'http://localhost:4000/api';

async function request(path, method='GET', body=null, token=null) {
  const headers = { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' };
  if (token) headers['Authorization'] = `Bearer ${token}`;
  const res = await fetch(`${API_BASE}${path}`, {
    method, headers, body: body ? JSON.stringify(body) : undefined
  });
  const data = await res.json();
  if (!res.ok) throw data;
  return data;
}

export async function signup(payload) { return request('/auth/signup','POST', payload); }
export async function login(payload) { return request('/auth/login','POST', payload); }
export async function getStores(query='', token) { return request(`/stores?${query}`,'GET', null, token); }
export async function submitRating(payload, token) { return request('/ratings','POST', payload, token); }
export async function getAdminDashboard(token) { return request('/admin/dashboard','GET',null,token); }
export async function getAdminUsers(q, token) { return request(`/admin/users?q=${encodeURIComponent(q||'')}`,'GET',null,token); }
export async function getOwnerDashboard(token) { return request('/stores/owner/dashboard','GET',null,token); }

Signup component (validations enforced server-side — but provide client checks too)

jsx
import React, { useState } from 'react';
import { signup } from '../services/api';

export default function Signup({ onSigned }) {
  const [form, setForm] = useState({ name:'', email:'', address:'', password:'' });
  const [err, setErr] = useState();
  const submit = async e => {
    e.preventDefault();
    try {
      const res = await signup(form);
      localStorage.setItem('token', res.token);
      localStorage.setItem('user', JSON.stringify(res.user));
      onSigned(res.user);
    } catch (e) { setErr(e.message || JSON.stringify(e)); }
  };
  return (
    <form onSubmit={submit}>
      <input value={form.name} onChange={e=>setForm({...form,name:e.target.value})} placeholder="Full name" />
      <input value={form.email} onChange={e=>setForm({...form,email:e.target.value})} placeholder="Email" />
      <input value={form.address} onChange={e=>setForm({...form,address:e.target.value})} placeholder="Address" />
      <input type="password" value={form.password} onChange={e=>setForm({...form,password:e.target.value})} placeholder="Password" />
      <button type="submit">Sign Up</button>
      {err && <div>{err}</div>}
    </form>
  );
}

UserStores page (list + submit/modify rating)

jsx
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { getStores, submitRating } from '../services/api';

export default function UserStores() {
  const token = localStorage.getItem('token');
  const [stores, setStores] = useState([]);
  useEffect(()=>{ load(); }, []);
  async function load() {
    const res = await getStores('', token);
    setStores(res);
  }
  async function rate(storeId, value) {
    await submitRating({ storeId, rating: value }, token);
    await load();
  }
  return (
    <div>
      <h2>Stores</h2>
      {stores.map(s => (
        <div key={s.id}>
          <h3>{s.name}</h3>
          <div>{s.address}</div>
          <div>Avg: {s.avgRating || 'N/A'}</div>
          <div>Your rating: {s.userRating || 'not rated'}</div>
          <div>
            {[1,2,3,4,5].map(v => <button key={v} onClick={()=>rate(s.id, v)}>{v}</button>)}
          </div>
        </div>
      ))}
    </div>
  );
}

5) Validation rules (server + client)

  • name: min 20, max 60 characters -> express-validator enforces isLength({min:20,max:60})

  • address: max 400 chars

  • password: 8–16 chars, at least one uppercase and one special char -> regex used above

  • email: isEmail()

  • rating: integer 1–5

backend/models/index.js

const { Sequelize, DataTypes } = require('sequelize');
const sequelize = new Sequelize(process.env.DATABASE_URL, {
dialect: 'postgres',
logging: false
});

const User = require('./user')(sequelize, DataTypes);
const Store = require('./store')(sequelize, DataTypes);
const Rating = require('./rating')(sequelize, DataTypes);

User.hasMany(Rating, { foreignKey: 'userId' });
Rating.belongsTo(User, { foreignKey: 'userId' });

Store.hasMany(Rating, { foreignKey: 'storeId' });
Rating.belongsTo(Store, { foreignKey: 'storeId' });

User.hasMany(Store, { foreignKey: 'ownerId' });
Store.belongsTo(User, { foreignKey: 'ownerId' });

module.exports = { sequelize, Sequelize, User, Store, Rating };

backend/models/user.js

const bcrypt = require('bcrypt');
module.exports = (sequelize, DataTypes) => {
const User = sequelize.define('User', {
name: { type: DataTypes.STRING(60), allowNull: false, validate: { len: [20,60] } },
email: { type: DataTypes.STRING, allowNull: false, unique: true, validate: { isEmail: true } },
password_hash: { type: DataTypes.STRING, allowNull: false },
address: { type: DataTypes.STRING(400) },
role: { type: DataTypes.ENUM('admin','user','store_owner'), defaultValue: 'user' }
}, {
tableName: 'users',
underscored: true
});

User.prototype.validPassword = function(password) {
return bcrypt.compare(password, this.password_hash);
};

return User;
};

backend/utils/jwt.js

const jwt = require('jsonwebtoken');
const secret = process.env.JWT_SECRET || 'change_this_secret';
function sign(user) {
return jwt.sign({ id: user.id, role: user.role }, secret, { expiresIn: '7d' });
}
function verify(token) {
return jwt.verify(token, secret);
}
module.exports = { sign, verify };

backend/middleware/auth.js

const jwt = require('jsonwebtoken');
const { User } = require('../models');
const secret = process.env.JWT_SECRET || 'change_this_secret';

async function authenticate(req, res, next) {
const header = req.header('Authorization');
if (!header) return res.status(401).json({ message: 'No token' });
const token = header.replace('Bearer ', '');
try {
const payload = jwt.verify(token, secret);
const user = await User.findByPk(payload.id);
if (!user) return res.status(401).json({ message: 'Invalid token' });
req.user = user;
next();
} catch (err) {
return res.status(401).json({ message: 'Invalid token' });
}
}

function authorize(...roles) {
return (req, res, next) => {
if (!req.user) return res.status(401).json({ message: 'Unauthenticated' });
if (!roles.includes(req.user.role)) return res.status(403).json({ message: 'Forbidden' });
next();
};
}

module.exports = { authenticate, authorize };

backend/routes/auth.js

const express = require('express');
const router = express.Router();
const bcrypt = require('bcrypt');
const { body, validationResult } = require('express-validator');
const { User } = require('../models');
const { sign } = require('../utils/jwt');

const passwordRegex = /^(?=.*[A-Z])(?=.*[^A-Za-z0-9]).{8,16}$/;

router.post('/signup', [
body('name').isLength({ min:20, max:60 }),
body('email').isEmail(),
body('address').optional().isLength({ max:400 }),
body('password').matches(passwordRegex)
], async (req, res) => {
const errors = validationResult(req);
if (!errors.isEmpty()) return res.status(422).json({ errors: errors.array() });
const { name, email, address, password } = req.body;
try {
const existing = await User.findOne({ where: { email } });
if (existing) return res.status(400).json({ message: 'Email already used' });
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, 10);
const user = await User.create({ name, email, address, password_hash: hash, role: 'user' });
const token = sign(user);
res.json({ token, user: { id: user.id, name: user.name, email: user.email, role: user.role } });
} catch (err) { res.status(500).json({ message: err.message }) }
});

router.post('/login', [
body('email').isEmail(),
body('password').isString()
], async (req,res) => {
const { email, password } = req.body;
try {
const user = await User.findOne({ where: { email } });
if (!user) return res.status(401).json({ message: 'Invalid credentials' });
const valid = await user.validPassword(password);
if (!valid) return res.status(401).json({ message: 'Invalid credentials' });
const token = sign(user);
res.json({ token, user: { id:user.id, name:user.name, email:user.email, role:user.role }});
} catch (err) { res.status(500).json({ message: err.message }) }
});

module.exports = router;

backend/routes/admin.js

const express = require('express');
const router = express.Router();
const { authenticate, authorize } = require('../middleware/auth');
const { User, Store, Rating } = require('../models');
const { Op } = require('sequelize');

router.use(authenticate, authorize('admin'));

// dashboard counts
router.get('/dashboard', async (req,res) => {
const totalUsers = await User.count();
const totalStores = await Store.count();
const totalRatings = await Rating.count();
res.json({ totalUsers, totalStores, totalRatings });
});

// add new user (admin creates normal user or admin)
router.post('/users', async (req,res) => {
const { name, email, password, address, role } = req.body;
const bcrypt = require('bcrypt');
if (!['user','admin','store_owner'].includes(role)) return res.status(400).json({ message:'invalid role' });
const hash = await bcrypt.hash(password, 10);
const user = await User.create({ name, email, address, role, password_hash: hash });
res.json({ user: { id:user.id, name:user.name, email:user.email, role:user.role }});
});

// list users with filters & sorting
router.get('/users', async (req,res) => {
const { q, role, sortBy='name', order='ASC', page=1, limit=20 } = req.query;
const where = {};
if (role) where.role = role;
if (q) where[Op.or] = [
{ name: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } },
{ email: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } },
{ address: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } }
];
const users = await User.findAndCountAll({ where, order: [[sortBy, order]], limit: +limit, offset: (page-1)*limit });
res.json(users);
});

// list stores with overall rating
router.get('/stores', async (req,res) => {
const { q, sortBy='name', order='ASC', page=1, limit=20 } = req.query;
const where = {};
if (q) where[Op.or] = [
{ name: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } },
{ email: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } },
{ address: { [Op.iLike]: `%${q}%` } }
];
const stores = await Store.findAll({ where, order: [[sortBy, order]], limit: +limit, offset: (page-1)*limit });
const result = await Promise.all(stores.map(async s => {
const avg = await Rating.findOne({
attributes:[[Rating.sequelize.fn('AVG', Rating.sequelize.col('rating')), 'avgRating']],
where: { storeId: s.id },
raw: true
});
return { store: s, avgRating: avg.avgRating ? parseFloat(avg.avgRating).toFixed(2) : null };
}));
res.json(result);
});

module.exports = router;
